comments:
Build ID: CDT 4.0.2.200711280800

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Create a debug session using the attach type
2. Debug
3. Pick the executing GCC app from the process list


More information:
You will see part of the log below. Note that I get the NPE on each thread it tries to stack walk. Note that the GDB works fine (I can attach and debug via command line).
The console shows:
attach 3144
[Switching to thread 3144.0xb30]

I get the exceptions only if I leave the C/C++ Application field in the launch config empty.
I think you need to enter the path to your executable.

(In reply to comment #1)
> I get the exceptions only if I leave the C/C++ Application field in the launch
> config empty.
> I think you need to enter the path to your executable.

OK, the problem is that it does this if the path is absolute (using the browse button). If I use the project relative path, it seems OK.

Note that it makes no effort to fill this in if I try to create a new one. For the local case, it at least shows it as an error (no program). For attach case, it says nothing about it. In the previous version, I believe, it would fill it in or pop a dialog to ask which one.
